p: Day length also serves as a cue for successful reproduction. Optimal synchrony of tissue‐specific peripheral circadian clocks, which may be impacted by perturbed photoperiodic cycles, is also essential for successful reproduction, as food and nutrient availability is key to fitness and survival (Reiter, Tan, Korkmaz, & Rosales‐Corral, 2013); hence, birth and rearing must be aligned to the time when these resources are accessible, while conserving energy when they are not. Under natural winter photoperiod and temperature conditions, male Syrian hamsters ( Mesocricetus auratus) experience gonadal regression mediated by the pineal gland (Reiter, 1973), through its release of melatonin (Reiter, 1991) and its downstream cascade.
